doc.name: armedIcon

syntax.example: set the armedIcon of button to {imageID | imageName}

doc.summary: Specifies an image to display in a button when the mouse pointer enters it.

examples.example: set the armedIcon of button "Trigger" to 2245

description.p: Use the armedIcon property to change a button's appearance when it is armed. Do not use this property to create hover icon effects, instead use the hoverIcon property.
The armedIcon property is the ID or name of an image to use for an icon. LiveCode looks for the specified image first in the current stack, then in other open stacks.
By default, the armedIcon property of newly created buttons is set to zero.
If the button's autoArm property is false, the setting of the armedIcon property has no effect.
